clinical_study.brief_title: Staphylococcus Aureus Surgical Site Infection Multinational Epidemiology in Europe
clinical_study.official_title: Staphylococcus Aureus Surgical Site Infection Multinational Epidemiology in Europe

brief_summary.textblock:
This is a retrospective multinational, multicenter cohort study with a nested case-control. The study includes all surgical procedures performed at a participating site to prevent bias.
Data will be assessed in two populations.
Cohort population: Export of electronic file data on demographics, surgical procedure ICPM code, duration of procedure, American Society of Anesthesiologists (ASA) score, body mass index, comorbidity ICD codes, and wound class of all patients undergoing surgery.
Nested case-control population: For patients establishing S. aureus SSI and 1:1 matched controls from the same center further data will be captured: Length of hospitalization, length of ICU stay and reason as well as attribution to SSI, survival at 30 and at 90 days, antibiotic treatments including duration, functional status at admission and at final discharge; necessity for surgical revision, and death attributed to SSI.
If readmission is necessary, reason and attribution to SSI, length of hospitalization and length of ICU stay as well as all antibiotic treatments and their duration will be recorded.
The cases causative pathogens including resistance patterns and type of SSI according to CDC criteria will be captured.
Matching criteria comprise the following:
- Type of procedure
- Age
- ASA score
- BMI
- Duration of procedure (as percentile for this procedure)
- Diabetes
- Sex

primary_outcome.measure: To determine overall incidence of Staphylococcus aureus surgical site infections in Europe
primary_outcome.description: Surgical site infections will be determined within the cohort of all patients that underwent surgery within 1 year at all participating sites.

primary_outcome.measure: To determine procedure specific incidence of Staphylococcus aureus surgical site infections in Europe
primary_outcome.description: Surgical site infections will be determined within the cohort of all patients that underwent surgery within 1 year at all participating sites. A subgroup Analysis will reveal procedure specific incidence.

secondary_outcome.measure: To determine the overall outcomes of Staphylococcus aureus surgical site infections in Europe
secondary_outcome.description: The Outcome will be assessed within the case-control part and achieved by comparison of Overall Outcome of cases and controls

secondary_outcome.measure: To determine the procedure specific outcomes of Staphylococcus aureus surgical site infections in Europe
secondary_outcome.description: The Outcome will be assessed within the case-control part and achieved by comparison of procedure specific Outcome of cases and controls

secondary_outcome.measure: To determine the overall economic burden of Staphylococcus aureus surgical site infections in Europe
secondary_outcome.description: The economic burden will be assessed within the case-control part and achieved by comparison of Overall economic burden (i.e. ICU Treatment, hemodialysis and mechanical Ventilation) of cases and controls

secondary_outcome.measure: To determine the procedure specific economic burden of Staphylococcus aureus surgical site infections in Europe
secondary_outcome.description: The economic burden will be assessed within the case-control part and achieved by comparison of procedure specific economic burden (i.e. ICU Treatment, hemodialysis and mechanical Ventilation) of cases and controls

other_outcome.measure: To characterize the composition of the surgical patient population in Europe
other_outcome.description: The composition of the surgical patient population in Europe will be performed by subgroup Analysis of the cohort

other_outcome.measure: To estimate the number of patients at risk for Staphylococcus aureus surgical site infection
other_outcome.description: This will be extrapolated from epidemiologcal data assessed within the cohort

other_outcome.measure: To estimate the economic burden, including direct treatment and indirect costs, imposed by Staphylococcus aureus surgical site infections in Europe
other_outcome.description: Direct and indirect Treatment costs will be assessed within the case-control part. Cases and controls will be compared regarding costs.

arm_group.description: Adult patients with SSI after any surgical procedure.

Cases: Patients establishing S. aureus SSI Controls: Patients from the same center who did not undergo S. aureus SSI, matched by the following criteria Type of procedure Age ASA score BMI Duration of procedure (as percentile for this procedure) Diabetes Sex

study_pop.textblock: Adult patients with SSI after any surgical procedure

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age ≥18 years at the time of surgery
Exclusion Criteria:
- Cases with missing data defined as "missing completely at random" (MCAR)
- Infection at the time of surgery
